newsitem.title: JAPAN: LDP, Hashimoto won approval in Japan poll-Kajiyama.
newsitem.headline: LDP, Hashimoto won approval in Japan poll-Kajiyama.

text.p: The government of Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto won approval in Japan's general elections on Sunday, Chief Cabinet Secretary Seiroku Kajiyama told a news conference on Monday.

"We failed to win a majority, but obtained 239 seats, more seats than we had before the election, so I can say the position taken by our party and the government of the prime minister won some degree of approval from the people," he said.
Kajiyama said Hashimoto's Liberal Democratic Party would seek cooperation from its current coalition partners -- the Social Democratic Party and Sakigake.
"However, it is desirable for us to team up with other parties and people who share a common viewpoint," he said.
